wikipedia_page.main: Charles Alfred Crickmore (11 February 1942 – 11 October 2018) was an English professional footballer. He played for Hull City, Bournemouth, Rotherham United, Norwich City,  Notts County and Gillingham between 1959 and 1972. He won a Football League Fourth Division championship medal in 1970 with Notts County and played in the Gillingham team that gained a surprise draw away to Arsenal in the Football League Cup.
